result.execSummary:
The defendant Lashell C Schmude was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay Fine 
Pay within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan and comply with the plan

Pay costs - Including DNA Surcharge and Drug Abuse Surcharge 
Pay within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan and comply with the plan

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lashell C Schmude

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Lashell C Schmude
Current: 5955 Birch Drive #22, Plover, WI 54467 United States  (Effective: 05-03-2016)
Prior: 5955 Birch Dr 22, Plover, WI 54467

Defendant Lashell C Schmude in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

10:27 AM Court calls case.
Atty Constable states appearances.

There is an agreement.

Defendant will plead to single count.
State recommends a fine of $50 plus costs and DNA and Drug Abuse Surcharges.

Atty Drengler concurs.
Defendant concurs.

Atty Drengler does not have a completed questionnaire at this time, just needs to be signed.

10:28 AM Atty Drengler takes a few moments to complete the questionnaire.

10:30 AM Court is back on the record.
Appearances remain as they were before the brief recess.

Court has received the plea questionnaire, waiver of rights.
Address of Defendant is verified.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST.

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Drengler for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1: Possession of Drug Paraphernalia

Atty Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court, Defendant is currently under supervision.
Atty Drengler makes sentencing arguments to the Court, joins in the State's recommendation.

Court questions Defendant. Defendant is a stay at home mother.
Court will adopt the State's recommendation.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1:
Pay a fine of $50 plus costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Pay Drug Abuse Assessment
60 days to pay or set up payment plan and comply with the plan

records.addlTxt:
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.

Defendant Lashell C Schmude in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
Court finds probable cause exists.
P/NG
State requests $500 sig bond with conditions.
BTC: Court sets bond.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 22, 2016 at 09:00 am.
